data.title: The Best Andrew Lincoln Movies
data.meta_description: List of the best Andrew Lincoln movies, ranked best to worst with movie trailers when available. Andrew Lincoln's highest grossing movies have received a lot ...
data.text:
Voting Rules

Vote for your favorite movies, regardless of critic reviews or how big the role was.

List of the best Andrew Lincoln movies, ranked best to worst with movie trailers when available. Andrew Lincoln's highest grossing movies have received a lot of accolades over the years, earning millions upon millions around the world. The order of these top Andrew Lincoln movies is decided by how many votes they receive, so only highly rated Andrew Lincoln movies will be at the top of the list. Andrew Lincoln has been in a lot of films, so people often debate each other over what the greatest Andrew Lincoln movie of all time is. If you and a friend are arguing about this then use this list of the most entertaining Andrew Lincoln films to end the squabble once and for all.

If you think the best Andrew Lincoln role isn't at the top, then upvote it so it has the chance to become number one. The greatest Andrew Lincoln performances didn't necessarily come from the best movies, but in most cases they go hand in hand.

The list you're viewing contains films like Moonshot and Scenes of a Sexual Nature.

"This list answers the questions, "What are the best Andrew Lincoln movies?" and "What are the greatest Andrew Lincoln roles of all time?"

Movie fans who love Andrew Lincoln have also been known to enjoy films starring Norman Reedus and David Morrissey.

Hugh Grant, Laura Linney, Colin Firth

Released : 2003

Directed by : Richard Curtis

In the heartwarming film Love Actually, nine intertwined stories explore the complexities of love during the festive Christmas season. The ensemble cast includes characters like Prime Minister David (Hugh Grant), writer Jamie (Colin Firth), and aging rock star Billy Mack (Bill Nighy). Their tales of romance, heartbreak, and discovery unfold against a backdrop of London's charming streets and homes. Directed by Richard Curtis, this multi-narrative comedy-drama offers a humorous and touching exploration of love's many forms. Its deft storytelling and memorable performances earned it a BAFTA Award for Best Supporting Actor for Bill Nighy.

2

Boston Kickout

Andrew Lincoln, John Simm, Marc Warren

Released : 1996

Directed by : Paul Hills

Boston Kickout is a 1995 British drama feature film written and directed by Paul Hills. It won the Euskal Media Prize at the San Sebasti√°n International Film Festival, Best Actor at the Cinema Jove International Film Festival in Valencia and Best Film at the Bermuda International Film Festival.

3

These Foolish Things

Lauren Bacall, Anjelica Huston, Andrew Lincoln

Released : 2006

Directed by : Julia Taylor-Stanley

These Foolish Things is a 2006 film based on Noel Langley's 1936 novel There's a Porpoise Close Behind Us and directed by Julia Taylor-Stanley. It stars Zoe Tapper, David Leon, Lauren Bacall, Anjelica Huston and Julia McKenzie. The drama was largely filmed on location in Bristol, Cheltenham and surrounding areas of Gloucestershire.

Released : 2006

Directed by : Ed Blum

On the lush green lawns of London's Hampstead Heath Park, a variety of couples commune and sort through their assorted romantic dilemmas. Brian (Douglas Hodge) asks his partner, Billy (Ewan McGregor), to cease his constant carousing. Gerry (Hugh Bonneville) and Julia (Gina McKee) slog through what appears to be a very bad blind date. Meanwhile, Iris (Eileen Atkins) gets a blast from the past when she encounters a man she had a fling with 50 years earlier.

5

Heartbreaker

Romain Duris, Andrew Lincoln, Vanessa Paradis

Released : 2010

Directed by : Pascal Chaumeil

Heartbreaker is a 2010 French romantic comedy directed by Pascal Chaumeil. Alex and his sister run a business designed to break up relationships. They are hired by a rich man to break up the wedding of his daughter. The only problem is that they only have one week to do so.

6

Moonshot

Andrew Lincoln, James Marsters, William Hope

Released : 2009

Directed by : Richard Dale

Moonshot is a 2009 television film depicting the story leading up to the landing of Apollo 11 on the surface of the Moon on July 20, 1969.
